intro: Psychotria subpunctata, commonly known as the spotted psychotria, is a flowering plant native to the tropical regions of Central and South America. It belongs to the Rubiaceae family, which includes over 13,000 species of flowering plants. The plant is characterized by its small, elliptical leaves with distinctive spots, and it produces small, clustered flowers that are typically white or pale green. It thrives in moist, shaded environments and is often found in humid lowland forests. Psychotria subpunctata is also known for its chemical compounds, some of which have been studied for potential medicinal properties.
